intro: Boerlagiodendron serratifolium, commonly known as the serrated-leaf boerlagiodendron, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with latex-producing properties. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in umbels. It typically grows in tropical lowland areas, often in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
